DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether APD334 is a safe and effective treatment for ulcerative colitis.
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of APD334 in Patients With Ulcerative Colitis
DOC.criteria: Moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis defined as a 3component Mayo Clinic score Evidence of colonic ulcerative colitis activity on endoscopy Within 30 days prior to randomization, receipt of any of the following for the treatment of underlying disease: Nonbiologic therapies (eg, cyclosporine, tacrolimus, tofacitinib, thalidomide), a nonbiologic investigational therapy or an approved nonbiologic therapy in an investigational protocol Within 60 days prior to randomization, receipt of any of the following: Infliximab, adalimumab, golimumab, certolizumab or any other investigational or approved biologic agent Any prior exposure to natalizumab, efalizumab, or rituximab
